title.narrative: 4.3 JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: 4.3 By 2025, justice and social welfare professionals have increased capacity to apply gender responsive and child friendly procedures, diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty for children in contact with law., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, the most vulnerable children benefit from a gender-responsive and functional child protection system that prevents and responds to separation, deprivation, violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

title.narrative: 4.3 By 2025, justice and social welfare professionals have increased capacity to apply gender responsive and child friendlyprocedures, diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty for children in contact with law.

description.narrative: 437 professionals and more than 300 children (48% girls) benefitted from UNICEF’s support. The Ministry of Interior has introduced 2,000 school-based inspectors-psychologists, tasked to work with vulnerable children, including children at risk and children in conflict with the law. In addition, UNICEF continued support to Government in enhancing children’s equitable access to justice, with a primary focus on preventing children’s deprivation of liberty through introducing non-custodial alternatives and sensitizing professionals on relevant international standards, and reintegrating children from closed-type special educational institutions into their families and communities through enhancing procedures and practices on rehabilitation and reintegration; ; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
